eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages

Class NetworkMessageRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessage
      • eu.bavenir.ogwapi.commons.messages.NetworkMessageRequest

  • public class NetworkMessageRequest
extends NetworkMessage
    Extended NetworkMessage that represents a request. Aside from fields inherited from parent it also facilitates transport of request body, parameters and attributes (which are basically just identifiers of respective properties, actions, tasks, ...). OGWAPI uses it like this: 1. It construct an instance of this class - uses the constructor without parameter. 2. Calls setRequestOperation and sets the requested operation etc. 3. Compiles a Map of attributes (like a property ID if there is a request that involves some property etc.) and calls setAttributes. 4. Does the same for parameters. 5. Builds the message by buildMessageString and obtains a string to be sent across the network. The final message is a JSON string, which was chosen as universal format to transport messages in the system. It was preferred over serialisation of the whole NetworkMessageRequest instance and sending it as a byte stream, because: a. There is no guarantee that future engines will be able to transmit such byte stream easily, but transport of a string should be a guaranteed feature of almost any protocol worth consideration (this is non-rigorous assumption of course, but necessary in the early stages of the project). b. The final JSON string is smaller than a byte stream of serialised NetworkMessageRequest instance (common sense :)). If there are any modification to this class, they will probably be about extending the range of operations or adding more fields that will be transported over the network. In the first case, add a constant with new operation code into the list and don't forget to add it also into the validateRequestOperation. In the second case don't forget to put the new field into the parser and builder. Note that such modification will make the new OGWAPI incompatible with the previous versions.
    Author:
    sulfo

    • Constructor Detail

      • NetworkMessageRequest

        public NetworkMessageRequest(org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                             java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        Constructor of a request message that is to be sent across the network. Request ID is computed during object's construction. The rest of attributes, codes, parameters, etc. need to be filled as needed.
        Parameters:
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

      • NetworkMessageRequest

        public NetworkMessageRequest(javax.json.JsonObject json,
                             org.apache.commons.configuration2.XMLConfiguration config,
                             java.util.logging.Logger logger)
        This constructor attempts to build this object by parsing incoming JSON. If the parsing operation is not successful, the result is an object with validity flag set to false.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON that arrived from the network.
        config - Configuration of the OGWAPI.
        logger - Logger of the OGWAPI.

        Sets the request's body.
        Parameters:
        requestBody - Body of the request.

      • buildMessageString

        public java.lang.String buildMessageString()
        Returns a JSON String that is to be sent over the network. The String is build from all the fields that were set with getters and setters. Use this when you are finished with setting the attributes, parameters etc.
        Returns:
        JSON String that can be sent over the network.

      • getRequestOperation

        public byte getRequestOperation()
        Returns the request operation that is to be executed. Valid values are the constants of this class starting with OPERATION prefix.
        Returns:
        Request operation identifier.

      • parseJson

        private boolean parseJson(javax.json.JsonObject json)
        Takes the JSON object and fills necessary fields with values. There are attributes that needs to be included in the JSON that is to be parsed ( see the implementation ). Therefore the JSON is first checked for these attributes and it is not until the check is complete when the parsing itself starts.
        Parameters:
        json - JSON to be parsed.
        Returns:
        True if parsing was successful, false otherwise.

      • validateRequestOperation

        private boolean validateRequestOperation(byte requestOperation)
        Validates the request operation code. If the code is not among the codes that are enumerated by constants, the verification fails. This check is preventing malicious remote gateways to ask us to do something, that this version of gateway is not capable of. NOTE: Every time there is a new operation implemented in the gateway, the operation code must be inserted among the constants as well as here.
        Parameters:
        requestOperation - Operation ID of the incoming message.
        Returns:
        True if the operation ID is valid for this gateway, false otherwise.

      • initialise

        private void initialise()
        Initialises empty fields.
